intro: Hibiscus brackenridgei, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 10 meters tall, featuring large, showy flowers with five petals. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces fruit that is a capsule containing numerous seeds. Hibiscus brackenridgei thrives in tropical climates and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of Hawaii. It plays an important role in the local ecosystem and is considered a keystone species in certain habitats.
